li.b: Lumipulse G Total Tau Immunoreaction Cartridges
li.p: Total Tau Cartridges are filled with Antibody-Coated Particle Solution, Biotinylated Antibody Solution, and Enzyme-Labeled Streptavidin Solution. Peel off the transparent film from the Immunoreaction Cartridge case before installing the case for measurement.

li.b: Lumipulse G Total Tau Calibrators set
li.p: Bring to room temperature (15-25 °C). Add exactly 1.0 mL of Reconstituting Solution to each lyophilized calibrator. Mix the calibrators by vortexing and use the calibrators as completely dissolved solution. Reconstituted calibrators may be aliquoted in sample tubes (i.e. same storage tube as the one used for CSF samples). These aliquots may be stored at 2-10 °C for up to 1 week or at -20 °C for up to 2 months when stored in a proper way avoiding contamination and evaporation. Calibrators may not undergo more than 3 freeze-thaw cycles. Dispense the required amount (more than 150 μL for duplicate measurement) of calibrators into the recommended sample cups, taking into account the dead volume which is at least 100 μL (total volume at least 250 μL). Refer to the LUMIPULSE G System Operation Manual for recommended sample cups, and the dead volume.

Use as is. Refer to the LUMIPULSE G System Operation Manual for installing into the LUMIPULSE G System and the package insert of Lumipulse G Substrate Solution for general information. Ensure the substrate cap seal is properly installed to avoid air entering the system.
